text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The joint commission approved a plan for the rapid demobilisation of UNITA and government troops within five months.
- Prime Minister Franca van Dunem met a delegation from the British company RTZ Mining and Exploration for talks on Angolan mining opportunities.
- Van Dunem also met Portugal's Minister of Interior Alberto Costa for talks.

- The United States Ambassador to Angola Donald Steinberg says he is satisfied with a UNITA proposal for dialogue on the government's national reconciliation programme ahead of the formation of a unity government.
- MPLA information secretary Joao Lourenco said he considered UNITA's proposal for dialogue with the government as a delay tactic.
